com.amlibtech.database
Class Database_Record_Base_V2

java.lang.Object
  com.amlibtech.database.Database_Record_Base_V2
public abstract class Database_Record_Base_V2
extends java.lang.Object

Database_Front_V2 is a front end to an SQL database. It should isolate most of the SQL from a programmer.

get_Key_Where_Clause

public abstract java.lang.String get_Key_Where_Clause()
Used by Database_Front_V2 to INSERT, FIND, DELETE, UPDATE a record.

Returns:
comma separated list of field_Name = ? of all field_Names in Primary Key.

get_Set_Clause

public abstract java.lang.String get_Set_Clause()
Used by Database_Front_V2 to UPDATE a record.

Returns:
comma separated list of field_Name = ? of all field_Names NOT in Primary Key.

preparedStatement_Encode

public abstract java.sql.PreparedStatement preparedStatement_Encode(java.sql.PreparedStatement preparedStatement,
                                                                    int order)
                                                             throws Database_Record_Exception
Used by Database_Front_V2 to encode fields into a SQL prepared statement. The first section is for fields in Primary key. See get_Key_Where_Clause . The second section is for the rest of the data fields.

Parameters:
preparedStatement - is the SQL statement with ? for values.
order - indicates which groups of values in which order are in the preparedStatement. order values can be:
  • ORDER_KEYS_FIRST used when index fields are at beginning of the preparedStatement. (addRecord(), INSERT INTO ...).
  • ORDER_KEYS_LAST used when index fields are at end of the preparedStatement. (updateRecord(), UPDATE x SET ... WHERE ...).
  • ORDER_KEYS_ONLY used when index fields are the only values in the preparedStatement. (is_Match(), getResultSet_Row(), Select * FROM x WHERE ..., deleteRecord(), DELETE FROM ...).
  • ORDER_KEYS_NEVER used when index fields are not in the preparedStatement.
Returns:
preparedStatement with values inserted where ? were.
Throws:
Database_Record_Exception - if any of the DFBase.get_PreparedStatement_Value(PreparedStatement preparedStatement, int count) fails.
See Also:
get_Values_Clause(), get_Set_Clause(), get_Into_Clause()

resultSet_Row_Decode

public abstract Database_Record_Base_V2 resultSet_Row_Decode(java.sql.ResultSet resultSet)
                                                      throws Database_Record_Exception
Used by Database_Front_V2 to decode SQL resultSet into data fields of record.

Parameters:
resultSet - is a ResultSet returned from PrepareStatement.executeUpdate().
Returns:
Database_Record_Base_V2 instance record.
Throws:
Database_Record_Exception - if any of the data_fields.DFBase Classes : setValue_ResultSet() fails.

get_Array_of_Records

public abstract Database_Record_Base_V2[] get_Array_of_Records(int array_Size)
Used by Database_Front_V2 to return many records.

Parameters:
array_Size - is the size of the array required.
Returns:
Database_Record_Base_V2 instance[] the size of array_Size as an Database_Record_Base_V2[].

getNext_Sort_Clause

public abstract java.lang.String getNext_Sort_Clause(int which_Index)
                                              throws Database_Front_Exception
Used by Database_Front_V2 to sort records.

Parameters:
which_Index - used to select which index to use. PRIMARY_INDEX is always available.
Returns:
SQL ORDER BY clause for selected index.
Throws:
Database_Front_Exception - if selected index is invalid.

getNext_Where_Clause

public abstract java.lang.String getNext_Where_Clause(int which_Index,
                                                      int skip_Levels)
                                               throws Database_Front_Exception
Used by Database_Front_V2 to split matching records into small sets of records. skip_Levels will increment as each prior level fails.

Parameters:
which_Index - used to select which index to use. PRIMARY_INDEX is always available.
skip_Levels - used to control how many fields of the index are to be used. As last field of multi-field index maxes out, We want to allow next to last field to increase. And then again on the next level. Etc.
Returns:
WHERE clause for which_Index and skip_Levels.
Throws:
Database_Front_Exception - if selected index is invalid.

getSQL_Create_Table

public abstract java.lang.String getSQL_Create_Table()
Creates a String containing an SQL command to generate table for this record.

Returns:
SQL CREATE TABLE Command.

                                                 Database_Front_V2 database_Front)
                                          throws Database_Record_Exception
Validate index fields of an html form.

Parameters:
httpServletRequest - contains values of submitted html form.
database_Front - used if values need to be validated against database.

Database_Record_Exception - if a value is invalid.
